paper_abstract: We model noisy clustering data using random graphs: Clusters correspond to disjoint sets of vertices. Two vertices from the same set (resp., different sets) share an edge with probability p (resp., r < p). We give algorithms that reconstruct the clusters from the graph with high probability. Compared to previous studies, our algorithms have lower time complexity and apply under wider parameter range. (C) 2007 Wiley Periodicals, Inc.
paper_title: Improved algorithms for the random cluster graph model
